title: To what extent should knowledge be free to everyone? - Quora

response.answer_text: that depends on your idea of Society No knowledge is ever denied to anyone in any society where every individual is expected to be a fully functioning independent unit, a force unto its own that AIN’T Expected to rely on anyone else for anything at all - the kids are free to experiment and copy and emulate and get under feet and watch and learn, but nothing NECESSARY is TAUGHT, somebody just does it, make a rope, find potatoes, build a boat, clean a fish, doctor a wound, rendering the entire world a classroom and every simple little action performed by EVERYTHING around from breathing to eating and walking and sleeping is a “life’s lesson” in an effective application of calories spent on calories gained, “be as the willow”,”the mighty oak”, “flow like a stream”, “stand like a rock”, “mantis style”, “lotus position”, “wolf in sheep’s clothing”, “they’re a snake”, “doctrine of signatures”, “leverage”, and all the rest. ALL Knowledge is denied to EVERYONE in any society of stratified hierarchical specialization where Your calories IN are STRICTLY Dependent on ‘Their’ calories’ out. The two systems are antithetical against each other, the one canNOT exist with other, they’re mutual enemies, and trying to merge ANY aspect of the one with the other CREATES all those “complicated” “complex” “confusions” INTELLECTUALS like to talk about as excuses why “the law needs lawyers”, “plumbing needs plumbers”, “doctoring needs doctors”, “economy needs economists”, “carpentry needs carpenters”, “engineering needs engineers”, “coding needs coders”, everything is “beyond your paygrade”, “Nothing is simple”, it’s all “over your head” as “an Art” or “a Science” strictly dependent on “qualifications” to even so much as READ about, “What are ‘you’ doing in ‘this’ section?”, You got “Proper Identification”?, “Practitioner’s License Number” from the PROPER “Issuing Agency or Organization”, etc. Once you set up a system where the food in your mouth is strictly dependent on a CHAIN of hands that AIN’T Yours before it even reaches your plate, you’ve taken a path there’s no easy return from. The THOUGHT Process, the REASONING has gone off into Delusions of Grandeur creating wants and needs and desires that canNOT exist without the reliance on “third party labor” that allows YOU the “luxury” of not having to disturb yourself with mundane concepts like food and water and temperature - that’s what “THEY” are There for. And once you got a “They”, “Be reasonable”, “who in their right mind would want it any other way?”

Knowledge should be free for everybody What does "knowledge should be free" mean? Everybody should be taught to read and write.Everybody should get free internet access (e.g. by providing computers in libraries)Scientific studies that were (complete or partially) funded by the country should be put online and be available without charge.Schoolbooks should be available online for free (for everybody, not only citizens!) and as a printed version that only covers the cost of printing. They should be written by teachers that get paid by the country.Any material created by teachers in public schools (that was created while they were employed) should be under CC+BY license.What does it not mean? Privately funded studies can still be kept private. Books written by authors that did not receive public funding can still be sold at any price.Why should knowledge be free? It provides chances for poor people.It could help poor countries.We - as a society - might get better educated and make decisions that are better. What consequences do I draw from this?
